attributes.action: Fairer and higher funding per school student
attributes.additional_details:
Since 2010 school budgets have been reduced in real terms by 8% (20% at post-16) 
-Class sizes are rising 
-Often, the most vulnerable students in schools are bearing the brunt of cuts, with schools struggling to provide the levels of support they are entitled to. 

Funding per pupil 2017/18 
London £5,872 
South West £5,181 
Yorkshire and The Humber £5,110 
West Midlands £5,087 
North East £5,029 
East of England £4,967 
East Midlands £4,953 
North West £4,912 
South East £4,832 
Cambridgeshire £4528
attributes.background:
Schools are still not being provided with adequate funding to deliver the level of provision and support that is expected and that our children deserve.

We are facing a funding crisis in our schools. With vast differences in funding per pupil; schools struggling with costs across the UK
